tasks.title: Enable/Disable
description: Confirm that the HSD can be enabled and disabled as intended.  In addition to basic functionality, also verify the following parameters are working as intended:
- Vout should be ~Vin
- Turn on time/slew rate
- Current sense feedback values are rational
- Vout should be ~0V when disabled (failure may not necessarily indicated an issue with this device specifically)

tasks.title: Soft Short Circuit
description: ### Setup
Connect the HSD input to a programmable DC power supply and the output to an electronic load.
Use a the eLoad or DMM to measure the output voltage. ('remote sense' may be neccesary)
Define a set of input voltages spanning the full operating range.
### Procedure
For each defined input voltage:
1. Set input voltage to the target level.
2. Slowly ramp the load current upward until the device enters protection or limiting mode.
3. At each steady-state current step, allow thermal stabilization of the power components.
4. Record output voltage, output current, and component temperatures once stable.
### Data to Collect
- Input voltage (VIN).
- Output current (IOUT) and output voltage (VOUT).
- Steady-state temperatures of all key power components.
- Point of current limit engagement or shutdown behavior.
### Pass/Fail Criteria
- HSD enters current limit or protection mode without catastrophic failure.
- Temperatures remain within rated limits under sustained stress.
- No permanent damage observed.
- Recovery behavior after overload is consistent with design intent.

tasks.title: Hard Short Circuit
description: ### Setup
Connect the HSD input to a DC supply at nominal VIN.
Prepare a controlled shorting method on the output (e.g., relay, FET to ground, screwdriver, etc).
Use an oscilloscope with current probe on the output path and voltage probe at the output node.
### Procedure
1) Power the HSD at maximum input voltage seen in operation.
2) Enable the HSD.
3) Apply a hard short from output to ground while monitoring scope traces.
4) Capture the output current waveform and output voltage response.
5) Observe system behavior: controller status, HSD integrity, and ringing.
### Data to Collect
- Output current waveform during short circuit event.
- Output voltage waveform including any undershoot, overshoot, or ringing.
- Controller behavior (reset, brownout, or continued operation).
- Post-event functional status of the HSD (damaged vs. normal).
### Pass/Fail Criteria
- Device survives without permanent damage or degraded functionality.
- Output current waveform shows expected current limit or shutdown behavior.
- Controller remains stable (no unintended reset).
- Voltage ringing at the output is within acceptable limits.

tasks.title: Current Sense Accuracy
description: ### Setup
Set power supply to nominal voltage.
Connect HSD output to an electronic load and sweep current from 0 A to maximum supported.
Measure actual output current with a precision meter.
Capture MCU ADC readings (raw codes or converted current).
### Procedure
1. Set VIN to nominal and turn on HSD.
2. Sweep output current in steps from 0 A to some max value.
3. Record actual current and ADC reading at each step.
### Data to Collect
- Actual output current (A).
- ADC-reported current (A or raw code).
### Pass/Fail Criteria
- ADC reading scales consistently with actual current.
- Accuracy within design tolerance across the full range.
- No premature saturation, clipping, or unexpected jumps.
